::Rodimus Prime/Kup::

Rodimus: I don't know, Windlord. But we have to do something.

Rodimus and Kup both started shooting at Sweeps. Rodimus didn't want to engage any of the tougher looking enemies untill he knew just what was going on.

Rodimus: I havn't gotton any response from Perseus. This could be real bad.

xochitla2006 <xochitla2006@...> wrote:                               Windlord:
 
 "do you think that Unicron and trelos are related?"
 
 --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@...> wrote:
 >
 > ::Rodimus Prime/Kup::
 > 
 > Rodimus and Kup both took cover behind a building after Rodimus 
 spotted the missiles coming from behind the Predacon eagle.
 > 
 > In the midst of the smoke and fire and chaos they both come out of 
 the cover to see something much worse then the previous missiles.
 > 
 > Rodimus Prime: Oh by Primus no...
 > 
 > Kup: This can't be what I think it is. I see Scourge and 
 Cyclonus... over and over again.
 > 
 > Rodimus: Unicron must have created an entire army based on the 
 reformatting that he did to the fallen Decepticons back in 2005.
 > 
 > Kup: So what are we dealing with here?
 > 
 > Rodimus: A huge force, possibly in the hundreds. I'd imagine that 
 most of the force is made up of Sweeps. Probably broken into 
 different squadrens each lead by a Scourge clone. A certain amount 
 of those clones probably answer to each Cyclonus clone. And...
 > 
 > Rodimus points to one of the minions flying near.
 > 
 > Rodimus: I'd imagine that above all these Unicronion Decepticons 
 are those... Unicron's personal Minions.
 > 
 > Kup: What could this mean, Roddy.
 > 
 > Rodimus: Unicron is finished waiting.
 > 
 > Rodimus opened a comm channel with Lord Perseus.
 > 
 > Rodimus: Well Trelos isn't an issue anymore. Unicron is making his 
 big push. I don't know how many Minions just joined the party but 
 I'm counting Unicronion Decepticon clones in the hundreds. Can we 
 get every weapon system the city has online like now?
 > 
 > supercyclonus <supercyclonus@...> 
 wrote:                               From the brightening side of 
 the moon a large wave of something rose 
 >  from its surface. Red like the landscape it flew from, it rose 
 into 
 >  the air. Then with a smooth twist of hue it turned black as the 
 >  shadows of space enveloped it. Like some black fog hunter-
 >  terminators, or sweeps as some call them, along with their leader 
 >  Scourge, gathered themselves under the direction of the mighty 
 >  Cyclonus. Then with lightening swiftness boosters flared turning 
 the 
 >  surface of the moon crimson for the briefest of moments before 
 they 
 >  struck out across open space, moving with precision and ease 
 toward 
 >  the unsuspecting inhabitants of the earth. 
 >  
 >  Inside the pacifist Maximal base in Atlantis the computers 
 continued 
 >  to monitor the grounds, primarily attempting to keep track of the 
 >  fleeing Trelos. But as always a few cones were pointed skyward, 
 >  always on the look out for Minions. What they saw today the 
 computers 
 >  had no way to understand. Something that was there and yet not 
 there. 
 >  The slightest bit of distortion, that under normal circumstances 
 >  would have been ignored, but in this case was large, and worse 
 yet, 
 >  it was moving. (OOC: Think of Predator's invisibility when he 
 moved) 
 >  
 >  A yellow warning light began to go off in the pacifist command 
 >  center, as the computer screen automatically projected course and 
 >  heading. Approximated heading: Atlantis. Unfortunately no one was 
 >  there to notice.
 >  
 >  On the grounds of Atlantis the pursuit of Trelos continues as 
 several 
 >  Maximals attempt to retrieve the rather elusive Predacon from his 
 >  newest hiding spot, underwater. One boat is on the water 
 obviously 
 >  searching, while a floating car hovers over the waters doing its 
 own 
 >  search. Meanwhile Rodimus has noted a rather odd dot in the 
 skies, 
 >  one that he can see to be a Predacon eagle. He is pointing at it. 
 And 
 >  even as he is doing this he notes something strange coming from 
 >  behind the eagle. The sky for a moment seems to flash and ripple, 
 >  almost like lightning, and yet there is a slight rotation to the 
 >  flashes. 
 >  
 >  In the skies above the eagle looks down noting Rodimus pointing 
 at 
 >  him, and he begins to drop out of the skies moving out over open 
 >  water, preparing either to flee, or do a strafing run. In either 
 case 
 >  he is totally unaware of what is transpiring over his head.
 >  
 >  On the grounds below Rodimus can see what is coming as his 
 enhanced 
 >  vision sees two very tiny dots spiraling out from the rippling 
 >  flashes. At the same time Klaxons begin to go off as base 
 computers 
 >  do actually recognize this threat: MISSILES!
 >  
 >  Erupting out of the skies, twin missiles streak across the skies, 
 >  vortexes of flames spiraling after them like crimson, cone shaped 
 >  contrails. They slam into communication towers, and the towers as 
 >  well as a few outlying buildings burst into flames. 
 >  
 >  In the background, almost unnoticed, a Myrmidon spirals out of 
 the 
 >  skies, the recipient of several laser blasts. Small gouts of 
 flames 
 >  flowing from him even as he impacts the water. Myrmidon sinks 
 beneath 
 >  the waves.
 >  
 >  And flying from amidst this bombardment Cyclonus rises high into 
 the 
 >  air.
 >  
 >  "The days you have known are over. All that you have belongs to 
 us! 
 >  Resist and be destroyed!! THE MINIONS OF UNICRON HAVE COME!"
 >  
 >  Even Cyclonus spoke sweeps arrive seeming to almost darken the 
 skies 
 >  for a momsnt, disintegrator blasts providing bright flashes of 
 light 
 >  as they bath Atlantis and the Maximal base in war.
 >  
 >  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
 >  
 >  OOC: I am sure other Maximal and Predacon bases/HQ's will note 
 >  something similar to what the Maximal base in Atlantis noted, 
 feel 
 >  free for anyone to jump in, if it makes sense. 
 >  
 >  The only thing of note is that the Sweeps and Scourge cannot be 
 >  locked on to with sensors (check out their profiles on wiki). 
 That 
 >  should not affect most of you very much, since most of you shoot 
 by 
 >  sight anyways, unless you are using base sensors or some remote 
 >  sensing capability. 
 >  
 >  Also any Minions that chose to come with are in this group as 
 well.
 >  
 >  
 >      
 >                                
 > 
 >  __________________________________________________
 > Do You Yahoo!?
 > Tired of spam?  Yahoo! Mail has the best spam protection around 
 > http://mail.yahoo.com
 >
